title: James Nixon (rugby league)
text:
James Nixon (born 10 August 1985) is a former <a href="Scotland%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Scotland</a> international <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer. He played on the for the <a href="Barrow%20Raiders">Barrow Raiders</a> in the <a href="Co-operative%20Championship">Co-operative Championship</a>. He represented <a href="Scotland%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Scotland</a> at international level on three occasions in 2009.
Background.
He was born in <a href="Dalton-in-Furness">Dalton-in-Furness</a>, <a href="Cumbria">Cumbria</a>, England, he is of Scottish descent.
Career.
Nixon announced his retirement from the game before the beginning of the 2013 season, but returned later that year to play for amateur side Dalton. He re-signed for Barrow ahead of the 2014 season.
Career records.
Nixon is seventh in Barrow's all time <a href="Try%20%28rugby%29">try</a> scorers list with 137 tries.
